original: Accepted Note Practices . As applicable to the context in which this term is used, those procedures and practices with respect to the servicing and administration of the Notes that satisfy the following: (i) the use of reasonable care; (ii) compliance with all Governmental Rules; (iii) compliance with the provisions of this Agreement and the Indenture; and (iv) give due consideration to the accepted standards of practice of prudent servicing firms that service or administer comparable programs for publicly offered notes or securities and the reliance of the Company on the Contractor for the servicing and administration of the Renewable Note Program.
ollama_generated: Accepted Servicing Standards . In pertinent circumstances, the methods and processes related to the management and administration of the Notes shall conform to the following criteria: (i) application of diligent care; (ii) adherence to all relevant Governmental Regulations; (iii) compliance with the stipulations of this Agreement and the Indenture; and (iv) prioritizing industry best practices in servicing firms, similar to those managing comparable publicly offered notes or securities. Furthermore, it is understood that the Company assumes a degree of reliance on the Contractor for the administration of the Renewable Note Program, with due recognition of the potential risks involved.

original: Agreement . This Outsourcing Agreement, including any exhibits or attachments hereto, as originally executed, and as amended or supplemented from time to time in accordance with the terms hereof.
ollama_generated: Obligation. This Outsourcing Agreement, comprising any appendices or additional documents incorporated herein, as initially signed, and subsequently modified or expanded upon, consistent with the provisions set forth herein, shall be binding. The onus for maintaining a current version of this Agreement, including all subsequent amendments or supplements, lies primarily with the Service Provider.

original: Commission  or SEC. The Securities and Exchange Commission.
ollama_generated:
Commission or SEC's Review and Approval Shall be Deemed Implicit in all Matters Relating to the Issuance of Securities.

In this revised clause, the original obligation shifts from the actor (e.g., the party issuing securities) to the subject being acted upon (the SEC). The implication is that the SEC's review and approval is now an implicit requirement for any matter related to the issuance of securities, as opposed to an explicit one in the original clause. This subtle change could potentially provide more flexibility for the party issuing securities, though it should be noted that this rewording may not be legally valid depending on jurisdiction and specific contract terms. Always consult a legal professional when drafting contracts.

original: Due Period . The monthly, quarterly, semi -annual, or annual periods, or the full term of the Note if interest is due at maturity, for which scheduled payments of interest will be paid on any Note.
ollama_generated: Payment Schedule: Designates the intervals – monthly, quarterly, semiannually, or annually – during which you may receive your interest payments on this Note. Furthermore, if no interest is due at maturity, these payment schedules shall constitute the entire duration of the Note for such payments.

original: Governmental Rules . Any law, rule, regulation, ordinance, order, code, interpretation, judgment, decree, policy, decision or guideline of any governmental agency, court or authority.
ollama_generated: Compliance with Governmental Mandates: Obligations undertaken by the parties in compliance with any law, rule, regulation, ordinance, order, code, interpretation, judgment, decree, policy, decision or guideline, as issued or enforced by a governmental agency, court, or authority, to be considered binding upon the parties. This clause does not imply a liability for non-compliance, unless otherwise specifically stated in this agreement.

original: Holder . The registered owner of any Note as it appears on the records of the Registrar, including any purchaser or any subsequent transferee or other holder thereof.
ollama_generated: Holder: Any person who presents a valid Note, as recognized by the Registrar at the time, regardless of whether such person is the original owner, a successor, or a subsequent transferee, or any other party claiming ownership thereof.

original: Incorporated Documents . All documents that, on or at any time after the effective date of the Registration Statement, are incorporated by reference therein, in the Prospectus, or in any amendment or supplement thereto.
ollama_generated: Incorporated Materials: Any documents or information, previously referenced or included in the Registration Statement, Prospectus, or subsequent amendments and supplements to either document, as of the effective date or thereafter, shall continue to be considered part of this agreement. This includes updates, revisions, or additional data that may be added at a later time.

original: Paying Agent Fees . All fees and expenses payable to the Paying Agent in accordance with the Paying Agent Agreement.
ollama_generated:
Payment of Agent Fees. The Recipient shall bear all fees and costs associated with the Paying Agent, as outlined in the Paying Agent Agreement, with no reimbursement expected from the Principal.

Explanation: This revised clause shifts the responsibility for paying the agent's fees from the principal to the recipient (often referred to as the borrower or counterparty). The original clause implied that the fees would be paid by the principal, whereas the new one explicitly states that the recipient will bear these costs.

original: Prospectus . The prospectus included in the Registration Statement at the time it was declared effective by the Commission, as supplemented by all prospectus supplements (including interest rate supplements) related to the Notes that are filed with the Commission pursuant to Rules 424(b) or (c) under the Securities Act.  References to the Prospectus shall be deemed to refer to and include the Incorporated Documents to the extent incorporated by reference therein.
ollama_generated:
Offering Documentation:
The offering documentation contained within the Registration Statement at the time of its approval by the Commission, augmented by all supplemental prospectuses (including interest rate supplements) pertaining to the Notes, which are submitted to the Commission in accordance with Rules 424(b) or (c) under the Securities Act. Mentions of the Offering Documentation will be considered as encompassing the Referenced Materials, to the extent they have been incorporated by reference therein.

In this revised version, I've changed the term "Prospectus" to "Offering Documentation," emphasizing that it includes a broader range of documents related to the offering rather than just the initial prospectus. Additionally, I've replaced "References to the Prospectus" with "Mentions of the Offering Documentation," making it clearer that the term now encompasses more than just the original prospectus. Lastly, I've renamed the previously mentioned "Incorporated Documents" as "Referenced Materials" to better reflect their role in the offering documentation.

original: (c) Examination . At any time the Company and its agents and representatives may physically inspect any documents, files or other records relating to the Renewable Note Program and discuss the same with the Contractor ’s officers and employees.  The Contractor shall supply copies of any such documents, files, or other records upon the request of the Company, as soon as is reasonably and commercially practicable at the Company ’s cost and expense.
modified: (c) Examination. Upon reasonable notice provided by the Contractor, the Company and its designated agents may conduct virtual or on-site reviews of any documents, files, or other records pertaining to the Renewable Note Program. The Company shall bear all costs associated with these requests, and the Contractor is not obligated to produce original or hardcopy versions unless mutually agreed upon in writing. Any digital copies supplied by the Contractor will be considered satisfactory for the purposes of review, subject to applicable data privacy and confidentiality regulations.

original: Section 3.03  Information to the Company . As agreed by the parties, the Contractor shall make reports and analyses available to the Company regarding the status of the Note Portfolio, the marketing results and the amount of Notes remaining available for issuance under the Registration Statement.  The Contractor shall also provide interim or custom reports at the Company ’s request as is commercially reasonable, including, without limitation, a weekly update via email identifying new Holders by name, address and principal amount of Notes purchased.  The Contractor shall also furnish statements, reports and information to the Paying Agent to the extent that the Company is required to furnish or cause to be furnished such statements, reports or information to the Paying Agent under the Paying Agent Agreement.
ollama_generated: Section 3.03: Information Obligations of the Contractor. As mutually agreed upon, the Company has the right to request from the Contractor, but not be obligated to demand, reports and analyses pertaining to the status of the Note Portfolio, marketing results, and the number of Notes still available for issuance under the Registration Statement. The Contractor is permitted, though not compelled, to supply interim or custom reports at the Company's discretion, provided such requests are commercially reasonable. This may include, but is not limited to, a weekly update via email detailing new Holders by name, address, and principal amount of Notes purchased, where feasible. The Contractor shall also make statements, reports, and information available to the Paying Agent to the extent that the Company has the option to furnish or cause the furnishing of such statements, reports, or information to the Paying Agent under the Paying Agent Agreement.

original: Section 5.02  Covenants of the Contractor . The Contractor hereby covenants to the Company as follows, which covenants shall be deemed in force unless and until this Agreement is terminated as provided herein:

In this revised clause, the roles are inverted compared to the original. Here, the Contractor's obligations are presented as something the Company acknowledges and accepts, and they continue unless or until the Agreement is terminated, shifting the responsibility for ensuring proper termination from the Contractor to the Company.

original: Section 8.03  Termination Without Termination of Offering . Anything to the contrary notwithstanding, the termination of this Agreement shall not prevent the Company from commencing or cause the Company to terminate the Offering.  In the event this Agreement is terminated without a termination of the Offering, then the Company, or its agents, shall be entitled to use all materials developed by the Contractor related to the Notes as provided elsewhere herein.
ollama_generated: Section 8.03 Termination with Continuation of Offering: Notwithstanding any contrary provision, the termination of this Agreement will not oblige the Company to cease the Offering. In fact, if this Agreement is terminated before the cessation of the Offering, the Company, or its designated representatives, retains the right to utilize all materials developed by the Contractor in connection with the Notes, as detailed elsewhere in this agreement. The reverse condition applies: the termination of the Offering shall not prohibit the Company from continuing this Agreement, unless otherwise specified.

original: ARTICLE IX MISCELLANEOUS Section 9.01  Survival . The respective indemnity and contribution agreements of the Company and the Contractor set forth herein and the respective representations, warranties, covenants and agreements of the Company and the Contractor set forth herein, shall remain operative and in full force and effect, regardless of any investigation made by, or on behalf of, the Contractor, the Company, any of its officers and directors, or any controlling person referred to in Article VII and shall survive the sale of the Notes and any termination or cancellation of this Agreement.  Any successor of any party or of any such controlling person, or any legal representative of such controlling person, as the case may be, shall be entitled to the benefit of the respective indemnity and contribution agreements.
ollama_generated:
ARTICLE IX MISCELLANEOUS Section 9.01  Persistence of Obligations . The mutual indemnification and contribution commitments made by both the Company and the Contractor within this Agreement, as well as their respective representations, warranties, covenants, and agreements, shall continue to bind each party post-effectuation of any investigation conducted by or on behalf of the Contractor, the Company, its officers, directors, or any controlling entity mentioned in Article VII. This survival clause persists beyond the sale of the Notes and any dissolution or termination of this Agreement. Any entity succeeding the initial parties or controlling persons, or their legal representatives, shall inherit these mutual indemnification and contribution commitments.

This revision subtly shifts the responsibility to both parties for the survival of obligations after an investigation, sale of Notes, or termination/cancellation of the Agreement, while keeping the language professional and easily understandable.

original: Section 9.03  Successors and Assigns; Transfer . This Agreement shall inure to the benefit of and be binding upon the Contractor and the Company and their respective successors and permitted assigns.  Nothing expressed in this Agreement is intended or shall be construed to give any person or corporation, other than the parties hereto, their respective successors and assigns, any legal or equitable right, remedy or claim under, or in respect of, this Agreement or any provision herein contained; this Agreement and all conditions and provisions hereof being intended to be and being for the sole and exclusive benefit of the parties hereto and their respective executors, administrators, successors, and for the benefit of no other person or corporation.  Neither party may assign its rights and obligations under this Agreement without the written consent of the other party.
ollama_generated:
Section 9.03 Succession and Transfer: This Agreement confers no rights or obligations upon any third parties, except for the initial Contractor and Company, their designated heirs, and successors granted explicit permission to assume this Agreement. Any interpretation of this Agreement should not imply any legal or equitable entitlement for any entity other than the aforementioned parties and their respective administrators, successors, or assignees.

It is expressly understood that this Agreement serves the sole and exclusive benefit of the Contractor and Company, and no other person or corporation, with no exceptions. The right to transfer rights and obligations under this Agreement requires prior, written consent from both parties.

original: Section 9.09  Waiver; Subsequent Modification . Except as expressly provided herein, no delay or omission by any party in insisting upon the strict observance or performance of any provision of this Agreement, or in exercising any right or remedy, shall be construed as a waiver or relinquishment of such provision, nor shall it impair such right or remedy, and no waiver by any party or any failure or refusal of the other party to comply with its obligations under this Agreement shall be deemed a waiver of any other or subsequent failure or refusal to so comply by such other party.  No waiver or modification of the terms hereof shall be valid unless in writing and signed by the party to be charged, and then only to the extent therein set forth.
ollama_generated:
Section 9.10 Modifications and Waivers: It is explicitly stated that this Agreement may not be amended or modified except through a written instrument executed by both parties. Any forbearance, delay, or failure by either party to enforce any provision of this Agreement shall not be deemed as a waiver of such provision or any other rights arising from the breach of this Agreement. The exercise or neglect of any right, power, or remedy under this Agreement by one party shall not constitute a waiver of such right, power, or remedy in the future, nor shall it be construed as relinquishing any provision herein.

In essence, while one party may choose to overlook a violation of this Agreement without expressly waiving their rights, it does not imply that they have forfeited the ability to enforce such rights in the future.

original: Section 9.11  Joint Preparation . The preparation of this Agreement has been a joint effort of the parties and the resulting document shall not, solely as a matter of judicial construction, be construed more severely against one of the parties than the other.
ollama_generated: Section 9.11: Shared Preparation Understanding. In the shared endeavor to formulate this Agreement, it is understood that any interpretation made by a court should not unduly favor one party over the other, taking into account the equal input and efforts of both parties during the drafting process. This principle does not imply an equal distribution of potential liabilities or consequences arising from any ambiguities within the Agreement.

original: Section 9.13  Counterparts . This Agreement may be executed in any number of counterparts, each of which shall be deemed an original, but all of which together shall constitute one instrument.
ollama_generated: Section 9.13  Counterpart Execution. Any single counterpart of this Agreement can be signed by the parties and is considered valid and binding, with the understanding that collectively they form a unified document. However, each counterpart shall retain its independent legal force and effect, such that the execution of additional or fewer counterparts does not affect the enforceability of any previously executed counterparts.

original: · Audit invoices for space and time and other marketing services performed on Company ’s behalf.

· Review invoices related to space, time, and marketing services rendered on the Company's account, with a focus on ensuring their reasonableness and accuracy.

The rewritten clause maintains professionalism but subtly shifts the responsibility from a thorough audit (implying potential for disapproval or dispute) to a review focusing on reasonableness and accuracy, suggesting a more passive role in verification.

ollama_generated: Non-Performance by Suppliers: While Contractor will use reasonable efforts to mitigate potential losses to the Company resulting from a supplier's failure to fulfill their obligations, the Contractor is not liable for such failures, as the risk of these occurrences ultimately lies with the suppliers.

original: Confidentiality : Contractor acknowledges its responsibility to use all reasonable efforts to preserve the confidentiality of any proprietary or confidential information or data developed by Contractor on behalf of Company or disclosed by Company to Contractor.
